reviews.review:
Portal - ein zeitloser Klassiker.

In Portal spielt man eine Versuchsperson in den Versuchslaboren der Firma ''Aperture Science''. Nach einem kurzen Tutorial bekommt man direkt die Hauptwaffe des Spiels ausgehändigt: Die Portal Gun. Mit dieser Waffe ist es möglich, Portale in Wände und Böden zu schießen und sich so zu ''teleportieren''. In den insgesamt 19 Leveln des Spiels muss man mithilfe dieser Portal- Gun teils sehr komplizierte Rätselareale lösen. Durch die Level wird man von einer künstlichen Intelligenz namens GlaDOS begleitet, welche im Verlauf des Spiels eine tragende Rolle einnimmt und ab etwa der Mitte des Spiels kristallisiert sich ein gewaltiger Plot-Twist heraus.

Das Spiel bietet sehr abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben in Form von Knobelaufgaben, bei denen man mit den Portalen tödliche Fallen überwinden muss, schnell reagieren muss um Laserstrahlen richtig zu lenken und kleinen Geschicklichkeitseinlagen. Das Ganze ist sehr spaßig gestaltet und bei den späteren Levels ist wirklich Denken angesagt. 

Desweiteren bietet das Spiel eine wirklich sehr gelungene Story, welche jedoch erst ab Mitte des Spiels an Fahrt aufnimmt. Leider bietet Portal nur eine geringe Spielzeit, jedoch wurde hier mit Bonuskarten und Challenge-Modi Abhilfe geschafft.

Top:
- Gut umgesetztes und durchdachtes Spielprinzip
- Fordernd
- Gute Story
- Man muss wirklich das Hirn einschalten um manche Level lösen zu können
- Bonusmaps und Challenge-Modi

Flop:
- Geringe Spielzeit

Fazit:
Portal ist mittlerweile ein echter Klassiker. Die Idee mit der Portal-Gun ist sehr gut und der Umgang mit selbiger ist astrein umgesetzt. Der Spieler wird hier vor eine wirkliche Herausforderung gestellt und es ist auch einfach mal etwas Anderes im Vergleich zum Gaming Einheitsbrei. Leider bietet Portal nur eine geringe Spielzeit und wer noch nicht genug davon hat, sollte sich unbedingt den Nachfolger Portal 2 ansehen. Klare Kaufempfehlung.

best game ever

As someone who had seen other people play Portal and having heard all of their opinions, I was a little biased coming into playing the game.  I  came in wanting to try and find everything wrong with it I could and try to tear it apart like I do most games.  But I played through it in about two hours non stop and was left incredibly satisfied.  At two, possibly three hours long it is definitely one of the shortest games I have ever played but that does not detract from it at all.  The central core mechanic, the Portal gun, is one of the most fun game mechanics ever made.  The puzzles were challenging and innovative, the humor was sardonic and dark, above all, I could not find anything I didn't like about it.  I have since played through it a couple more times trying to complete different challenges and Steam achievements but it's still super fun! I am someone who tends to play a lot of FPS and sandbox type games but I have to say Portal is by far my favorite game.  Good mechanics, no QTEs (quick time events), interesting and contemplative puzzles, and above all, the best sense of humor I have ever seen/heard in a video game. I highly recommend it for the humor and incredible central mechanics as well as it being a short and sweet change of pace from the FPS QTE filled mainstream garbage most games have become.  I rate 100/100 for no faults and the most sardonic antagonist I have ever heard.
This is one of those games where you sometimes rage at but you still love it at the same time.  It is amazing.
absolutely amasing game :D ive played through this one a few time, and its still lots of fun!

Portal si propone come un rompicapo per eccellenza, aggiungendo l'esperienza in prima persona stile FPS, oltre che alla storia e ai retroscena (quelli emersi dai fanboy, perlopiù), piuttosto interessanti. La grafica si basa sul motore Source, il gioco è di per se semplice quindi nel prendere confidenza non si hanno problemi, e l'unica pecca è che forse fin troppo corto. Gli scenari sono malinconici ma ben si adattano alle circostanze nella quale vi trovate, la grafica non la commento visto che si tratta di un motore grafico con oramai 10 anni alle spalle, l'audio idem non credo si possano far valutazioni lucide, al momento. 2,6 ore registrate su Steam (secondo me un po di più) per completare il gioco totalmente, morendo anche più e più volte (per cercare di sbloccare gli Achievement!!). Al prezzo che si trova ora è un titolo consigliatissimo, almeno una volta nella vita dovreste giocarci, sopratutto se pensate di giocare anche al seguito, visto che questo risulta semplice e vi permetterà di assimilare la meccanica di gioco in maniera basilare. Lo consiglio assolutamente, è da avere in libreria

Glados- это супер компьютер которые использует вас как крысу для своих испытании, и в конце конечна пытается вас убить. Но мы как та убегаем) и Glados пытается нас вернуть, но нет мы ее находим первыми и уничтожаем  (была легко). Именно за счёт этого все трудности преодолеваются на ура, ибо с нетерпением жаждешь услышать следующую шуточку от ИИ. 19 головоломок, плюс крайне неожиданный конец, плюс дополнительные усложнённые миссии ждут ваших решений. Portal is a magnificent puzzle game. The titillating wrongness of every solution and the "JUSTNOIDEA" thinking required to get there make you feel like a space-folding genius, and yet you'll almost never get stuck. Skilled players will portal their way through the nineteen levels in just a few hours, but this little puzzle game / tech demo provides plenty of entertainment and makes a great addition to The Orange Box. I know there's a lot of hype over this game, but it 100% lives up to it.
Controls are consistently good. Visuals hold up well and contribute a lot to the atmosphere, as does the music. (Mariachi opening music is the BEST.) Characterization and story is very well done, unexpected for a puzzle-based FPS. 
The difficulty is fair; while not overly difficult, it requires you to use a lot of mental acuity and quick reflexes at the same time. There's only a few hours of gameplay, but there's no filler; a great example of a game that's short but sweet.
The main hook in Portal, the gameplay, is one of the most innovative things ever done in an first-person game. It's about 8 years old at this point, but instead of becoming outdated, I think it's just become more apparent that this game is a classic. Definite recommendation.
I was told there would be cake...
THIIIIIIIS GAME IS SO AWSOME

I can't explain how amazing this game is, not only gameplay but idea behind the whole Portal series. I spent long hours to read about the story after I finished Portal. I could talk and talk about what I love most, but it's not the point, I'm just wish everyone reading that great adventure as I experienced playing this game. ;)

What is there to say? It's Portal, a game you've likely already heard about by now. With it's clever level design that rewards you for thinking outside the box, it's charming (yet limited cast) of characters, to it's wonderfully atmosphereic soundtrack, it's well worth the price of admission at just 10 dollars! If you get for anything less on sale, it's practically a steal!

The game stars you, Chell, a test subjection at Aperture Science, trying to go through a bunch of test chambers in order to reach the end, where you're promised some cake! Aperture Science isn't the safest facility though, so don't expect to breeze through these chambers without a little trouble here...and there...

Your only line of defense against these chambers and their hazards? Your trusty Portal Gun. You can shoot Portals like you would with pretty much any other gun, but Portals can only form on certain surfaces. After you place two down, you can freely travel between the two and go just about anywhere with some careful Portal placement.

While the game IS pretty short, there are a couple of challenges you can play that are likely to test how good your Portal skills REALLY are. In addition, there are also some really good fan-made Portal map packs out there, such as Portal: The Flash Version Mappack, that you can attempt if you're craving some more action.

It's kind of hard to say if this game or it's sequel is superior. Portal 2 is a much longer game with some more gimmicks added to allow for more possibilities when it comes to solving a test chamber for a solution, but had a much less rememerable soundtrack.However, I would strongly urge you to play (and complete!) Portal 1 first before attempting the latter. That way you get the full experience.

Pros:
- A game with a wonderful, yet very dark, sense of humor.
- Easily one of the most unique FPSes I've ever played (and still one of my favorites).
- A beautiful atmospheric soundtrack with a very catchy credits song.
- An incredibly charming cast of characters.
- Pretty cheap.
- Very entertaining and insightful developer's commentary.
- The Challenge Maps and the "Least Amount of Steps", "Least Amount of Portals" and "Fastest Time" challenges offer a bit more to the game after you've completed all of the test chambers.

Cons:
- The game not including the bonus challenges is a bit short. You'll likely complete this game in under a few hours of on and off play.
- The sequel has a much better user-friendly map editor, so you'll likely find more new content for that game. Despite this, there are still some good map packs out there.

Overall, a fantastic game. Don't judge my amount of play time (I've pumped more time into this game then what it's telling you), as I have played this game before on an older Steam account of mine that I no longer have access to, and on The Orange Box for the Xbox 360. Of course, I'd recommend playing the PC release simply because most PCs can probably run this game just fine now, and the additional maps you can download online.
